name: Cinnamon & Coconut rolls
title: Walnut & Coconut White Chocolate Rolls (Bejgli)

ingredients.title: Walnut filling for 2 rolls
content: 0.5 kg finely and crudely minced walnut (or just go finely mixed all the way)

ingredients.title: Coconut white chocolate filling for 2 rolls

steps: Put the yeast and yolk into a room temperature milk and stir it a bit
Put the powdered sugar and flour into a bowl and mix those a bit
Include the butter to and do another mixing
Pour the stirred milk mix into the the bowl and mix this until the dough comes off your hands (This will take some time and arm strength)
Create 4 equally sized dumplings and put these into the fridge while all of them are wrapped in foils (Rest these doughs until you're finished with the fillings)
Warm up both fillings's milk in a slow cook. If you're finished then isolate half the milk for the walnut filling
COCONUT TIMEEEEE! While having the leftover milk in the cooking pot, put the vanillin, coconut, butter (maybe the chocolate too if you want?) then stir them

Include the salt and the flour into the filling and stir it until they get creamy, but not runny. Add a tiny bit flour if it feels too runny? Do some sample tasting if it needs any tweaks for ya. If you're finished, cover the pot with a lid and let it coool (Skip to walnut filling to save time)
After it has cooled down, grate 1 lemon and 1 orange skin into it.

WALNUT TIMEEEEE! Grab a bowl and put the walnut, cinnamon, vanillin, orange and lemon skin and stir them a bit. It's not necessarily a requirement, but you could have a finely and crudely minced walnut.
Pour the warm milk into them and stir it. Don't let it be too dry or too runny. Do some sample tasting if it needs any tweaks for ya.

ASSEMBLING TIMEEEEE! Take out 1 dumpling dough, knead them out into a rectangle / square shape if you can (I was only able to make ellipses). The dough's width should be around 5-7 mm. (Using a roller with warm water in the cylinder can help greatly. The dough was really sticky for me ngl)

Spread half of the walnut or coconut filling on the dough as evenly as you can with leaving 1 cm space on all sides. ONLY FOR THE COCONUT: Smash the chocolate into tiny pieces and sprinkle them on the fillings evenly. Do this for all the 3 remaining dumplings

Press down the left and right edge of the dough with your fingers, then fold those ONCE and press them down a bit again. This one helps to create a better aesthetic look after the baking will finished
Roll up the from down-to-top gently and lubricate the rolls with 1 egg yolk and put them into the freezer for 15 mins

Lubricate it with egg whites, wait a bit and just put them into the oven for 200 Celsius in upper-under baking mode to 35 minutes (or just watch until it looks tastyyy :3). If you have a modern oven, you probably need to lower the heat to 160 C, I have accidentally ruined this masterpiece
Don't eat yet hungry fella, just let it rest overnight with a cloth over it.
TASTE THE WONDER! ^^

name: Scrambled eggs
title: Scrambled Eggs

content: 2-4 chopped up slices of bell pepper or green paprika
Enough vegetable or olive oil to just mostly cover the pan

steps: Chop the onion as small bits as possible
Chop some slices from the paprika (I usually do 5-6 slices of green paprika per-say) and slice up these pieces into small bits too
Slice up the hams or salamis just like the way the onion or paprikas have been done
Put your pan on low heat and pour just enough oils to cover the whole surface (or almost cover it).
Throw the chopped up ingredients into it. Don't forget to stir the contents 20 seconds every time
While cooking the ingredients, crack up those eggs into a bowl, add a bit of salt to it and beat them UP! 游볡
If the ingredients have been cooked just enough for you (ex: onions are browned along the edges) then pour the eggs into the mix and stir them until the eggs have been cooked just enough for you
Add some mayoram, black pepper or any other spices you feel it would the food well
ENJOY!

name: Jam Filled Yeast Pastry
title: Jam Filled Yeast Pastry

infos.tools: huge bowl, baking tray, roller, optionally a dough mixer

ingredients.title: Dough
content: 25 g fresh yeast or 7g dried yeast

steps: Put a little bit of sugar and the yeast into a room temperature milk, then stir it a bit to start the yeast process
Combine the flour, salt, sugar, 2 egg yolk, grated lemon skin and the yeasty milk together into a huge bowl and stir them up until the dough starts to come together (1-3 minutes probably)
Add the butter/margarin and finish the dough forming process (definitely more than 1-3 minutes)
Cover the dough with a wrap, tray or whatever and let it rest for 35 minutes
Create 2 equally sized dumplings and shape them into a rectangle. Cover them with 2 bowls and let them rest for 10-15 minutes
Knead these out into a rectangle shape if you can and cut every dumpling into 6 equally sized pieces (There should be 12 pieces if you have 2 dumplings)

Put 1 line of jam (size unknown currently) on each pieces (horizontally center, but vertically it should be closer to the bottom a bit). Fold it once, then close all the gaps by pressing them down (don't be too gentle). After that roll it once, and press both ends, plus the rolled dough line
Repeat this with the others
Bring out a baking tray, put a baking wrap onto it and put all of these pieces onto it (folded lines should be at the bottom!)
Lubricate them with 1 egg and rest them for 30-50 minutes
Lubricate them again and put it into the oven for 180 C for 20-25 minutes
TASTE THE WONDER! ^^

sources.title: Hagyom치nyos 칈zes Bukta h치zilag - G치bor a H치zi P칠k

name: "Slovakian" Sandwich Paste
title: "Slovakian" Sandwich Paste

infos.tools: GIGANTIC pot, big pot, some bowls, food mixer, bunch of glass jars, huge and warm blanket
infos.serves: Your entire ancestry tree 6 levels deep atleast

steps: Cook the beans in a pot on a low and consistent heat, until they soften. This process takes several hours, probably around 4-6 maybe
In the meanwhile mince the bell peppers, red onions and carrots, but do NOT mix them yet. Please store them in separate bowls
After your beans have cooked well enough, mince them finely as well with the mixer
Pour a little bit of oil into your most massive pot and cook your onions until they browned well enough to your taste
Pour the minced bell peppers, carrots, beans and the rest of the oil into the pot and continously stir them a while while cooking it
After that, add the tomato soup, bay leafs, salt and parsley to the mix and continoue the cooking process as said before (around 20 mins maybe?)
Just before you plan to finish, include your NA benzonate into the mix and your cooking phase has finally been finished
Grab a bunch of glass jars and pour the mix into these, and close them as tightly as possible
Cover all of them in a really dense blanket or anything insulating to make them cool down slowly with eachother
Put them away in a slightly cold area, like in your pantry and leave them to cool for 2-3 days
If they have completely cooled down, then you can finally enjoy the delicacy of this beautiful recipe :3

sources.title: The unmeasurable power of my grandma and her village's ingenuity :3
